credentials: PHD 1987 VA Polytechnic Inst & State U
name: CAITILYN ALLEN

ratings.comment: Professor Allen is an excellent and experienced lecturer and does a great job conveying biological processes to students who are not studying plant pathology. Lab was easy but there were a lot of lab reports which take time. Lecture participation is graded. Very few readings/work outside of the lab(~33% of final grade).

Easy content, but participation is graded & lectures are on paper, not posted online. Labs are 30% of grade, exams make up the rest--not difficult, but TAs look for specific answers, which isn't always clear in questions. If you're looking for an easy A international studies, look elsewhere unless you test well & know you have time for lab reports.

Absolutely amazing lectures that are super interesting. Lab is a ton of fun if you have a good group. If not it is not so fun. I loved my lab but I know others did not. The bad thing is the class is graded on a few things. I got a B on one exam and an A on the others and all other assignments and I barely got an AB

Plant Path 123 is a great course if you need a Bio credit or International studies! The lectures were pretty straight forward and had tons of relations to other subjects that were not science. The exams are difficult, but extremely fair. Professor Allen has a contagious passion for science!

Lectures are easy but worth going to: frequent in lecture participation checks AND they're just good lectures. Labs are pretty fun, lab reports every few weeks and a semester long project. Over all fantastic class, and I hope to have Dr. Allen again as I start taking higher level Botany/Plant Pathology classes for the major.

Great if you're not a huge fan of bio. Ties concepts to historical/social contexts, making the course much more engaging. Tests: relatively easy if you pay some attention in lecture, and don't need much rote memorization.

Honors-optional project is easy & flexible: basically just design any project that dives deeper into a course concept.
So many lab reports. Randomly a group lab report at the very end. Semester long project on either sourdough or kombucha.

If you are looking for a bio science credit I highly recommend this class. The labs are super chill and fun. You do have to write 3-4 lab reports during the semester but I would always crank them out the day they were due for 2 hours and get an A. Everything you look for in a professor she has. GO TO LECTURE! Tests require thought but are fair.
Professor Allen is one of my favorite professor at UW-Madison. Inspirational lectures that you can relate to. Clear grading criteria.

I took this class for gen ed credit but ended up really enjoying all the content, especially in the last unit when Dr. Allen talks more broadly about the environment. She is extremely knowledgeable and caring, and she was always helpful during office hours. Not a difficult class but you do have to study for the exams and write a few lab reports.

I thought Prof. Allen was fine; she was condescending to the class at first, but as the semester progressed, she became nicer and more empathetic to students struggles with the concepts. She curved the first exam after backlash from the students for having an avg. of 69%; although reluctantly. She adapted the class to the students which I respect.

To be quite frank this class online was the worst class I have ever taken. The professor is condescending and doesn't listen to the suggestions of the students. There was a yeast project that spanned the entire semester, it was the WORST! The test preparation was nonexistent. She gave you no material that resembled even slightly to the tests.

Labs had no instructions, exams were poorly formatted, a TA taught the second unit, and the grading was subjective and vague. First exam Av. was 69. She then insulted Sophomore and junior stem majors by telling them that they were high school level. It's hard to teach during COVID-19, but still, this kind of issue is too large to go unrecognized.

Dr. Allen has high expectations, but she makes it easy to meet them by welcoming student questions, asking guided questions, simplifying concepts, and inviting in-class participation. Her passion for evolution and microorganisms is infectious, and I would HIGHLY recommend taking a course with Dr. Allen if you can.

Prof. Allen is my favorite professor here at UW-Madison. She is so knowledgeable, genuinely cares about her students, keeps lectures interesting, and is, in general, a super cool and accessible person. She is happy to meet with you outside of class and she hosts exam review sessions! I honestly wish I could take Plant Path again next semester.

I took this course to fulfill International Studies. Content is very understandable and Prof Allen gives out copies of her power points that can't be found online so definitely go to lecture. Labs are super simple as well and not much more is needed to be prepared than to print the lab procedure. Prof Allen makes microbes be interesting.

The class was really awesome and she is one of my favorite professors here. She really knows what she's talking about. Even though lecture attendance isn't mandatory, she prints out the notes for you and doesn't post them online to encourage you to go to lecture. Overall great class. Exams aren't hard if you even don't study for a long time.

VERY good professor: she makes the class very fun. Pretty basic information, and she explains it pretty well. Labs are satisfactory, though the grading on them is a little picky, so do a good job. Tests for me looked easy, but you really had to make sure you were answering the question ( I did okay on her tests). Go to review sessions.

Professor Allen is one of the best professors I have had at UW. An extremely intelligent and passionate prof. who cares about what she teaches. She hands out powerpoint print outs at every class so make sure to show up! Tests are essay format and you pick five questions out of seven.

Awesome teacher! This class is great for nonsci majors who need science/lab credits. SO EASY. She really cares about the topics she teaches. She hands out copies of every powerpoint during class, so make sure you show up. And there's a short essay question in lecture every week, which is used to measure attendance.

seriously Hard Class ave 70% almost everyone I knew got less than 70% if you want to taka this professor u really have to UNDERSTAND EVERYTHING she teaches. and in Exams you really have to specific, if not you will get less than 10 out of 20. doesn't matter how long is your answer.

She's extremely intelligent and clear. Lectures are good, usually interesting. She's very good at bringing material into a global perspective. Has a knack for handling tough subject matter regarding creationism vs. evolution. Over all very clear, rarely rambles, has a great disposition.  Labs are a bit much to keep up with, heavy work load.
The material is extremely interesting, and she's got a great way of clarifying more complex stuff. Over all, It's the work load is a bit challenging, but she seems concerned and a  pretty good prof.

I think she's great. The lectures are very well prepared and I like how she put everything in a broader context. The tests are extremely easy if you study at all. The lab experiments and reports are very frequent and there's too many of them going on at the same time to keep track of so that's annoying.  Good way to get rid of science requirement!

I'm in the class now and it's a mild disaster. The class seems to have been put together rather slipshod and they haven't been doing much to correct it. Half the time the TA's don't seem to know what's going on and, in my interactions with them, they all seem slightly hostile, which is uncommon for me. Poorly organized and exams are rigged for fail
PLANT PATH her class is freking hard class ave 70% final
